DataElement.preferredName: Fallopian Tube Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Group Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Stage group determined from information on the tumor (T), regional node (N) and metastases (M) and by grouping cases with similar prognosis for fallopian tube carcinoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of tubes that extend from the uterus to each of the ovaries. Following ovulation the egg travels down the fallopian tube to the uterus where fertilization may or may not occur._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of tubes that extend from the uterus to each of the ovaries. Following ovulation the egg travels down the fallopian tube to the uterus where fertilization may or may not occur.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.longName: Fallopian Tube
Concepts.definition: One of a pair of tubes that extend from the uterus to each of the ovaries. Following ovulation the egg travels down the fallopian tube to the uterus where fertilization may or may not occur.

Concepts.longName: Neoplasm
Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Stage Grouping; an assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage. (caDSR)

Concepts.longName: Stage Grouping
Concepts.definition: An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CRF standard harmonization. Released per final community approval. mc 5/7/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Fallopian Tube Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Group Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A term that refers to the staging of fallopian tube carcinoma according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer, 7th edition._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that the extent of organ/tissue involvement by a malignant neoplasm is not reported or not assessed.

Concepts.longName: Stage Unknown
Concepts.definition: The extent of organ/tissue involvement by a malignant neoplasm is not reported or not assessed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage 0 includes: Tis, N0, M0.  Tis: Carcinoma in situ (limited to tubal mucosa). N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. FIGO no longer includes stage 0. (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage 0 Fallopian Tube Cancer AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage 0 includes: Tis, N0, M0.  Tis: Carcinoma in situ (limited to tubal mucosa). N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. FIGO no longer includes stage 0. (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage I includes: (T1, N0, M0); IA (T1a, N0, M0); IB (T1b, N0, M0); IC (T1c, N0, M0).  T1: Tumor limited to the fallopian tube(s).  T1a: Tumor limited to one tube, without penetrating the serosal surface; no ascites.  T1b: Tumor limited to both tubes, without penetrating the serosal surface; no ascites.  T1c: Tumor limited to one or both tubes with extension onto or through the tubal serosa, or with malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage I Fallopian Tube Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage I includes: (T1, N0, M0); IA (T1a, N0, M0); IB (T1b, N0, M0); IC (T1c, N0, M0).  T1: Tumor limited to the fallopian tube(s).  T1a: Tumor limited to one tube, without penetrating the serosal surface; no ascites.  T1b: Tumor limited to both tubes, without penetrating the serosal surface; no ascites.  T1c: Tumor limited to one or both tubes with extension onto or through the tubal serosa, or with malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IA includes: T1a, N0, M0. T1a: Tumor limited to one tube, without penetrating the serosal surface; no ascites.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IA Fallopian Tube Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IA includes: T1a, N0, M0. T1a: Tumor limited to one tube, without penetrating the serosal surface; no ascites.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IB includes: T1b, N0, M0.  T1b: Tumor limited to both tubes, without penetrating the serosal surface; no ascites.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IB Fallopian Tube Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IB includes: T1b, N0, M0.  T1b: Tumor limited to both tubes, without penetrating the serosal surface; no ascites.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IC includes: T1c, N0, M0.  T1c: Tumor limited to one or both tubes with extension onto or through the tubal serosa, or with malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IC Fallopian Tube Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IC includes: T1c, N0, M0.  T1c: Tumor limited to one or both tubes with extension onto or through the tubal serosa, or with malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage II includes: (T2, N0, M0); IIA: (T2a, N0, M0); IIB (T2b, N0, M0); IIC (T2c, N0, M0).  T2: Tumor involves one or both fallopian tubes with pelvic extension.  T2a: Extension and/or metastasis to the uterus and/or ovaries.  T2b: Extension to other pelvic structures.  T2c: Pelvic extension with malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage II Fallopian Tube Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage II includes: (T2, N0, M0); IIA: (T2a, N0, M0); IIB (T2b, N0, M0); IIC (T2c, N0, M0).  T2: Tumor involves one or both fallopian tubes with pelvic extension.  T2a: Extension and/or metastasis to the uterus and/or ovaries.  T2b: Extension to other pelvic structures.  T2c: Pelvic extension with malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIA includes: T2a, N0, M0.  T2a: Extension and/or metastasis to the uterus and/or ovaries.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIA Fallopian Tube Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIA includes: T2a, N0, M0.  T2a: Extension and/or metastasis to the uterus and/or ovaries.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIB includes: T2b, N0, M0.  T2b: Extension to other pelvic structures.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIB Fallopian Tube Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIB includes: T2b, N0, M0.  T2b: Extension to other pelvic structures.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIC includes: T2c, N0, M0.  T2c: Pelvic extension with malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIC Fallopian Tube Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIC includes: T2c, N0, M0.  T2c: Pelvic extension with malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage III includes: (T3, N0, M0); IIIA (T3a, N0, M0); IIIB (T3b, N0, M0); IIIC (T3c, N0, M0); (Any T, N1, M0).  T3: Tumor involves one or both fallopian tubes, with peritoneal implants outside the pelvis.  T3a: Microscopic peritoneal metastasis outside the pelvis.  T3b: Macroscopic peritoneal metastasis outside the pelvis 2 cm or less in greatest dimension.  T3c: Peritoneal metastasis outside the pelvis and more than 2 cm in diameter.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  N1: Regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage III Fallopian Tube Cancer AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage III includes: (T3, N0, M0); IIIA (T3a, N0, M0); IIIB (T3b, N0, M0); IIIC (T3c, N0, M0); (Any T, N1, M0).  T3: Tumor involves one or both fallopian tubes, with peritoneal implants outside the pelvis.  T3a: Microscopic peritoneal metastasis outside the pelvis.  T3b: Macroscopic peritoneal metastasis outside the pelvis 2 cm or less in greatest dimension.  T3c: Peritoneal metastasis outside the pelvis and more than 2 cm in diameter.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  N1: Regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIA includes: T3a, N0, M0.  T3a: Microscopic peritoneal metastasis outside the pelvis.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIA Fallopian Tube Cancer AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIA includes: T3a, N0, M0.  T3a: Microscopic peritoneal metastasis outside the pelvis.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIB includes: T3b, N0, M0.  T3b: Macroscopic peritoneal metastasis outside the pelvis 2 cm or less in greatest dimension.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIB Fallopian Tube Cancer AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIB includes: T3b, N0, M0.  T3b: Macroscopic peritoneal metastasis outside the pelvis 2 cm or less in greatest dimension.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIC includes: (T3c, N0, M0); (Any T, N1, M0).  T3c: Peritoneal metastasis outside the pelvis and more than 2 cm in diameter.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  N1: Regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIC Fallopian Tube Cancer AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIC includes: (T3c, N0, M0); (Any T, N1, M0).  T3c: Peritoneal metastasis outside the pelvis and more than 2 cm in diameter.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  N1: Regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IV includes: (Any T, Any N, M1).  M1: Distant metastasis (excludes metastasis within the peritoneal cavity). (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IV Fallopian Tube Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IV includes: (Any T, Any N, M1).  M1: Distant metastasis (excludes metastasis within the peritoneal cavity). (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)
